resources.string: 2 types of consciousness rooted in delusion

INCLUDED IN A COMBINATION WITH 15 CHETASIKAs: 

 UNIVERSAL:
 >> 1. Contact (Phassa) 
 >> 2. Feeling (Vedanā) 
 >> 3. Perception (Saññā) 
 >> 4. Volition (Cetana) 
 >> 5. One-pointedness (Ekaggatā) 
 >> 6. Management life-ability (Jīvitindriya) 
 >> 7. Attention (Manasikāra) 

 HAPPENING FROM TIME TO TIME: 
 >> 8. Starter application (Vitakka) 
 >> 9. Sustainable application (Vicāra) 
 >> 10. Energy (Viriya) 
 
 UNIVERSAL UNBENEFITABLE: 
 >> 11. Misconception (Moha) 
 >> 12. Shamelessness (Ahirika) 
 >> 13. Fearlessness of evil deeds (Anottappa) 
 >> 14. Anxiety (Uddhacca) 

 ADVERSE THINGS THAT HAPPEN FROM TIME TO TIME: 
 >> 15. Doubt (Vicikicchā)

 >> 10. Determination (Adhimokkha)
 >> 11. Energy (Viriya) 
 
 UNIVERSAL UNBENEFITABLE: 
 >> 12. Misconception (Moha)
 >> 13. Shamelessness (Ahirika)
 >> 14. Fearlessness of evil deeds (Anottappa)
 >> 15. Anxiety (Uddhacca)
EXAMPLE: A person, due to delusion, doubts the enlightenment of the Buddha or the effectiveness of the Dhamma as a path to liberation.
EXAMPLE: A person is so distracted that he cannot focus his mind on any object.

1 
 One consciousness, accompanied by calm, associated with doubt. 
 
 Upekkhāsahagatam vicikicchāsampayuttam ekam.

2 
 One consciousness, accompanied by calmness, associated with anxiety. 
 
 Upekkhāsahagatam uddhaccasampayuttam ekan ti.
